content:
@nikomatsakis it seems like we need a repo to get the localization process working. Would you be able to create a repo for this?
Looking at existing repos, one could argue that https://github.com/rust-lang/community-localization could make sense as a home for translations instead of creating a new one, but perhaps a new repo would be good as a place to collect any non-sensitive information pertaining to the survey.
The right way to create repos is to file an issue on rust-lang/infra-team with the name + who should have access (ideally the who is a team repo controlled github team)
Ah sorry! Ok I can do that :blush:
The repo has been created and populated: https://github.com/rust-lang/surveys
